definition: lit. throw out a brick and get jade thrown back (idiom)/fig. to attract others' interest or suggestions by putting forward one's own modest ideas to get the ball rolling
to throw/to toss/to fling/to cast/to abandon

to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters

sentences.english: In doing this, more people will be inspired and encouraged to write.
sentences.chinese: 如此抛砖引玉，能激发与鼓励更多人加入写作队伍。

sentences.english: The above is only the power of the individual peep-hole view, thoughtful.
sentences.chinese: 以上只是个人的了一孔之见，权当抛砖引玉。

sentences.english: I'll probably do the guttering or something.
sentences.chinese: 我很可能会做些抛砖引玉的工作。

sentences.english: This research will help more and more people to study sculptural process aesthetics in the future.
sentences.chinese: 这将为以后的雕塑过程美学研究抛砖引玉。

definition: lit. a brick thrown to prompt others to produce a jade (idiom)/fig. a modest suggestion intended to prompt others to come forward with better ideas
to venture to/to presume to/to take the liberty of
to get the ball rolling (abbr. for 拋磚引玉|抛砖引玉[pao1 zhuan1 yin3 yu4])
to just talk for the sake of talking
some cases picked out as example/to highlight
to provide as expedient/to use temporarily as/to make shift
lit. to toss a stone to find out what's ahead (idiom)/fig. to test the waters
to point out mistakes or weak points for correction/to comment/criticism
